result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: This case dismissed but read into 15CF34.

Defendant Joshua Dean Louis in court with attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp.  Defendant Joshua Dean Louis in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
This case dismissed but read into 15CF34.  Restitution to victim in this case was ordered in case 15CF34.

Attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE is in Sawyer County Jail, but is not needed for hearing so proceeds.
OFF THE RECORD.  After discussion of parties, Speedy jury trial remains scheduled for one case- 15CF112.  15CF109, 15CF16, 15CF34 & 15CF111 track with. 
Pre-trial motions and jury instructions must be filed by 8-31-16.

Final pre-trial on August 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on September 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua Dean Louis in court with attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp.  Defendant Joshua Dean Louis in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Kemp Acknowledges receipt of Information - entered pleas of Not Guilty.  Court entered ng pleas.  Atty Kemp makes speedy trial demand.  Court - contact JA for trial date or clerk of court's office.  Review scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Joshua D. Louis in court with attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp.  Defendant Joshua D. Louis in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   3:23 PM  Court calls case(s).  Court advised the defendant as to his right to have a preliminary exam.  DE does not wish to have a preliminary hearing.  Court finds defendant has freely waived his right to a prelim - finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  





  Arraignment scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Arraignment scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joshua D. Louis in court, in custody appearing by video. with attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp in court, Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Kemp motions court for reduction in cash bond.  DA objects.  Court denies motion for bond reduction.  Due to DE's attorney's schedule inability to work with court calendar, no choice but to go beyond 10 day time limit requested.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 03:10 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Defendant Joshua D. Louis in court, in custody, with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Moldenhauer states he has a potential conflict in at least one of the DE's cases which have been all been set for Preliminary Hearings today.  (15CF34, 16,109,111,112)
DE does not object to withdrawal, is advised of rights to preliminary hearing which is offered to still be held today.   DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing in all cases..
 Court allows withdrawal of Atty Moldenhauer.
Atty Moldenhauer motions court to allow DEF furlough to attend a funeral in MN.  State objects due to effort that would be needed to get DEF back to this state if he does not return.  Court denies.
Bond continues.  Conditions of bond are presented on the record to the DEF while he is present, as they were changed on 2-26-16 after DEF was no longer connected to the courtroom by video.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
